pageContext.claim: “Take a look at some of these countries where they don’t play games. They don’t have a drug problem.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has often pointed to Singapore as a model. But Rick Lines, executive director of Harm Reduction International, says that while Singapore consistently claims that it has one of the lowest rates of drug use in the world, this claim is impossible to verify because the government does not publish reliable data on drug use. "What the narcotics bureau’s 2016 report does show is that seizures of both methamphetamine and cannabis increased by approximately 20% over the previous year, while heroin seizures remain basically level," he said.
